intro: Peponia kilimandscharica var. subintegrifolia, commonly known as the African horned melon, is a striking plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and squash, and is characterized by its large, spiky, green fruits. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with wavy edges and can grow up to 3 meters in height. Its flowers are yellow with five petals and are followed by the distinctive, horn-shaped fruits that turn from green to orange as they mature.
